documents.document: Think self-awareness is same as self-indulgence? Am sure you don't want to be like #Trump!
@MrJonnyBenjamin If schools still produced citizens, #MentalHealthMatters would be significant, they produce workers now so diff priorities.
@clarercgp Kindness left the platform a longtime ago. We are a competitive society, who has time for kinship?
He just wants the White House. She is the one who wanted to give the present so she carries it? https://t.co/lWIby96uYw
Love is all you need. https://t.co/4dY6p5ReW0
Is the liberal left going to wake up or continue in its delusion, berating others? #Trump #Politics #Psychotherapy https://t.co/Kbo7sY9Y66 …
If the past year teaches us anything, it is not to take our freedoms for granted. Don't be a bystander, be active in changing your world.
@MrJonnyBenjamin Painful, isn't it? Recognising & accepting that reality will help you to change it.
Our mind isn't a thing but a process. When you affect someone deeply, a piece of your mind stays with them & you. https://t.co/n4zLbdkq7L
We use substances to escape suffering. Suffering is a part of life & needs to be endured. If you're escaping life, what are you living for?
I guess the Qatari Investment Authority need that money more than the workers? https://t.co/jpp0yfebnk
What is the House for? https://t.co/7mhu7vjetU
Reach out. Gain help. Continue to bring yourself together. Don't give up on yourself & return to ways that you know are unhelpful.
@SameiHuda Not sure I follow your argument. Imagine the study is signif. 'cos antidepressants sometimes promoted as reducing risk of suicide
@EdithSurrey Perhaps results of first are in one's face, provoke fear, deemed legit but the 2nd are more abstract so easier to disregard
Love is all we need. There isn't enough love in the world. What are you doing to ameliorate the problem?
Wonder why India's Minister for women @Manekagandhibjp links publicity about rapes to the impact upon tourism? Which is more important?

@TessBerryHart @vicderbyshire Good luck. I hope you are treated better than some others recently.
We all are responsible for the energy we create in the world. https://t.co/tse7FmmSXF
@RaiWaddingham I would say in a sick society, we are all sick. First step to the cure must be to realise our common sickness w/o projecting.
Wondering about the pardon for gay men who stood up for themselves. Isn't it a bit like forgiving freedom fighters or suffragettes? Apology?
Do you speak of your soul or just do small talk? Why do we hide so?https://t.co/SK1exJNvDU
If we all focussed on changing ourselves, the world would surely change. Difficult though, isn't it?
Is it true that we "should always just be ourselves"? Surely self examination is necessary 'cos Trump is being himself & it's not ok.

Some important questions for all here. I don't agree that others are always the same & constant but mostly I concur. https://t.co/R57D4MZYx9
Religion, myth, magic, nature, feelings and relationships together with rationality make life worth living https://t.co/7sWEBN2tYH
@sgbrownlow I imagine we try to maintain positive affect mainly in order to avoid troubling emotions. Does that sound true to you?
A big thank you to @TessBerryHart for Cargo, thoughtful play about how close the world is to losing all that is good. Bravo.

Important to respond to one-sided programmes such as one from Stephen Fry on his manic depression so here we are: https://t.co/MKToYB9vsm
@askdheeraj @SameiHuda To me, pts understanding narrative of their own lives is worth all cost. What else do we have in life?
@SameiHuda Sure. Nothing works all the time. Sometimes it is not meant to make sense.
@SameiHuda If pts say that after a lot of digging sometimes years on, it makes sense then I go with that. Meantime they feel heard. Win win
@SameiHuda If we are patient, in time I believe it does make sense. That's what a lot of the patient movement & psychotherapy lit says..
A good attempt at starting a conversation between 'pure scientists' and psychotherapists. https://t.co/Ho4iL27H9y
What is psychotherapy and do I need it? A brief animation.... https://t.co/eZBQ2MeA5Z
@SageSilk RD Laing said 'treatment is the way we treat each other'. Perhaps they need to be asked why the treatment is so harsh?
@SameiHuda Of course I believe in recovery & that hard work is needed on all sides. Wondering about the lessons for the NHS in this, if any.
@SameiHuda What do you think of his recovery? What helped? Do we know?
Grounding and focussing training in Manchester with someone who knows... https://t.co/Qa6o5Bvr6t
@maddoggie2 An eye for an eye makes the whole world blind, comes to mind.
@frozenwarning @SameiHuda @OCDTrudy LOL. I'm against harm to patients but also fundamentalism & scientism.
@frozenwarning @SameiHuda @OCDTrudy has repeatedly said she's been helped by the holistic approach taken. Listening to patients is useful.
@frozenwarning @SameiHuda @OCDTrudy It would seem to me some of us r more open to acknowledging expertise in others. How about respect?

@psycholdham @SameiHuda @d_galasinski @HviteOern As ever, issue abt working together to understand. 'Together' bit is what we're rubbish at.
There's to be a new Minister for Mental Health. Perhaps we'll have some equity now with other health concerns. Brilliant idea #Corbyn

Without meaning or purpose in life, what are we living for? In fact, is it a life if there is no meaning?
